HTMLOutputElementSetCustomValidity.summary: The setCustomValidity() method of the interface sets the custom validity message for the {{htmlelement("output")}} element. Use the empty string to indicate that the element does not have a custom validity error.

remarks.para: The <output> element is not a candidate for constraint validation. The method will not cause the custom error message to be displayed to the user, but does set the property of the element's object to true and the property to false.

-CSS :valid and :invalid pseudo-classes
